question: A 20-year-old man was brought to the emergency room presenting with seizures, paresthesia, cramps, and tetany. After managing his symptoms, his blood calcium levels were investigated and were found to be lower than normal. The doctor explained to the patient's attendant that he had a disease that was caused by the deficiency of a specific hormone. What is the most common cause of this condition?

A 15-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with backache, moon face, and truncal obesity. On examination, the child has elevated blood pressure and delayed reflexes. The laboratory results show increased cortisol levels. What is the most likely disease from which the boy is suffering?

A 42-year-old woman presents to the clinic complaining of excessive facial hair and irregular menstrual cycles. On physical exam, the patient has truncal obesity and a characteristic 'moon-facies'. CT of the head shows a mass in the pituitary gland. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following symptoms characterizes diabetes insipidus?

A lady arrives at the clinic for the delivery of her baby. After the delivery, the lady has significant bleeding and exhibits post-partum symptoms of poor lactation, loss of pubic hair, and fatigue. Which of the following describes the condition the patient is suffering from?
Which of the following is the most common neoplasm of the thyroid?

A 26-year-old woman presents to the clinic due to fatigue and difficulty in breastfeeding her 5-week-old baby. She also notices a slower growth of pubic hair, constipation, weight gain, and severe fatigue. Antenatal history is unremarkable, however, she has a history of severe bleeding with blood transfusion right after her delivery. What is the diagnosis of this patient?
Which of the following is correct regarding gene mutations responsible for parathyroid neoplasia?

answers.option: Cyclin D1 gene deletion leads to over-expression of cyclin D1 and thus causes parathyroid adenoma
The most important susceptibility locus for parathyroid adenomas is the HLA gene cluster on chromosome 6p21
MEN-1 mutations are responsible for parathyroid tumors
The mutations causing parathyroid adenomas are rarely sporadic
GNAS mutations are responsible for familial parathyroid tumors

question: Which of the following is the most important complication of metabolic syndrome that leads to type 2 diabetes?
Exophthalmos is most strongly associated with which of the following pathologies?
A person with diabetes mellitus has defect in which type of pancreatic cells?
Extremely high iodine levels lead to which of the following?
The Chvostek sign is seen in which of the following conditions?
Phentolamine is used to reduce hypertension in which of the following conditions?
Congenital hypothyroidism is most commonly associated with which of the following congenital anomalies?
What is the most common cause of congenital hypothyroidism worldwide?

answers.option: Failure of thyroid gland to develop
Lack of iodine intake in childhood

question: What is the best diagnostic test for Cushing syndrome?

answers.option: 24-hour urine collection for analysis of free cortisol

question: What is the test for Graves disease?
A woman comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of being restless for the past 3 months. She has a single painless swelling in her neck. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following statements is wrong about the Sheehan syndrome?

answers.option: It can present as cold intolerance
It results from ischemia to pituitary gland
It is associated with antepartum hemorrhage
It is associated with postpartum hemorrhage

question: Hyperthyroidism is characterized by which of the following?
If the growth hormone level in the blood is increased due to a tumor of the pituitary gland, then which cells of the pituitary gland are most likely affected by the tumor?
Which of the following is not a feature of Cushing syndrome?

answers.option: Increased mobilization of fat from the lower body

question: A deficiency of which of the following hormones can cause a life-threatening condition?
Which of the following is the most common pituitary disease?
Tetany is seen in which of the following conditions?
Prolactinoma is a tumor of what type of cells?
Secondary hyperparathyroidism can arise due to which of the following?
In gigantism, which of the following cell types is overactive?
Excessive parathyroid hormone causes which of the following conditions?
Which metabolic derangement is seen in Conn syndrome?
Which of the following leads to Addison disease?

answers.option: Tertiary disorder of the cortisol hormone system
Functional disability of the hormone cortisol
Abnormal growth of the thyroid gland

question: Which of the following involves excessive secretion of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH)?

A 40-year-old woman presents with 5 kg weight loss over 4 months, heat intolerance, and palpitations. On examination, there is diffuse thyroid enlargement. Serology shows TSH receptor antibodies. Which of the following is the correct diagnosis?
What is the best sign seen in hyperthyroidism?
Which of the following is the most common cause of congenital hypothyroidism worldwide?
What is the mode of inheritance of congenital adrenal hyperplasia?
Which of the following is the diagnostic test for acromegaly?
What is the cut-off for fasting blood glucose level in diabetes?
What is the most common cause of hypoparathyroidism?
What is the most common cause of hyperparathyroidism?
Which of the following is the most sensitive test for myxedema?
Which of the following is a diagnostic test for pituitary tumors?

A pregnant woman, with no previous history of diabetes, started developing hyperglycemia, coupled with polyuria and glycosuria in her 2nd trimester. She is brought to the emergency room on the 29th week of gestation and an emergency caesarian is performed. Her baby is born overweight and develops seizures immediately after birth. Which of the following is the most likely reason for the baby's condition?

A 25-year-old male comes to the outpatient department with complaints of intermittent headache and nausea for 4 months. On examination of the eyes, he has slightly impaired vision and diplopia. What is the most appropriate diagnosis for this patient?
Which of the following is not seen in Cushing's syndrome?
What is cretinism?
An excess of mineralocorticoids will cause which of the following?

A woman presents to the emergency with amenorrhea and milk secretion for the past 2 months. On examination, it was found that the patient has pituitary adenoma. Which of the following hormone, released by the tumor, is responsible for the patient's symptoms?

A person known to have small cell lung carcinoma presents to the outpatient department and had developed hyponatremia. Which of the following hormone released by the carcinoma is responsible for the patient's symptoms?
In hypopituitarism, secretion of which hormone is affected first?
A person may get brown skin due to which of the following conditions?
A person with pulmonary tuberculosis undergoing treatment for 3 months is likely to develop which pathology?
What is the major lifestyle risk of developing type 2 diabetes mellitus?
Which of the following is correct regarding Sheehan syndrome?

answers.option: During pregnancy posterior pituitary enlarges twice its size

question: Which of the following is the most common type of pituitary adenoma?
A patient with excess growth hormone will have which of the following conditions?
Which of the following will help confirm Addison's disease?

A 35-year-old female went to see her doctor because she had been feeling hot lately and was sweating at night. Her T3 and T4 levels were found to be high, whereas her TSH level was low. What is the most likely diagnosis made by the doctor?
The superior parathyroid gland developed from which of the following?
Which of the following is the most common disease of the thyroid in mountainous areas?
A patient diagnosed with acromegaly typically presents with which of the following?
Genetic abnormalities are associated with pituitary adenomas. Which of the following is the most common genetic abnormality in pituitary adenomas?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH)?
Which of the following is true for Addison disease?

answers.option: Infectious diseases are the major cause
Occurs due to hypofunction of adrenal gland
Occurs due to hyperfunction of pituitary gland
Occurs due to hyperfunction of adrenal gland

question: A 40-year-old man comes to the OPD complaining of muscle weakness. He is 6 feet tall and has a protruding lower jaw, along with enlarged hands and feet. What is your diagnosis of the patient and what will you expect his lab tests to reveal?

answers.option: Hashitoxicosis, with increased T3 and T4, and low TSH
Gigantism, with increased GH and IGF-1
Acromegaly, with increased GH and IGF-1
Cushing syndrome, with increased midnight plasma cortisol

question: In which of the following conditions is human growth hormone given?
Which of the following does not occur in panhypopituitarism?
Deficiency of which hormone causes fatty liver?
Which of the following is not associated with acromegaly?
Growth retardation occurs due to deficiency of which hormone?
What are the main clinical features of a prolactinoma?

answers.option: Vision disturbance, headaches, and mood swings

question: Which of the following is the confirmation test for Addison's disease?
Thyroid storm is seen in which of the following diseases?
A 6-month-old baby boy was diagnosed with thyroid hormone deficiency. What is the most appropriate medical terminology used for this patient?
Graves disease is an example of which type of hypersensitivity?
Which of the following is the confirmatory test for acromegaly?
Which of the following is not seen in hypopituitarism?
How to differentiate between type 1 and type 2 diabetes mellitus?

answers.option: By the presence of peptide c

question: One of the reasons for gigantism is the oversecretion of which of the following hormone?

An old lady with a diagnosis of hyperthyroidism undergoes a thyroid scan. The findings show increased uptake of radioactive iodine in a solitary circumscribed area. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Hypoparathyroidism most commonly occurs secondary to which of the following?

answers.option: Congenital absence of the parathyroid glands

question: Which of the following is the most common parathyroid tumor?
In which of the following conditions, thyroid-stimulating hormone does not respond to thyrotropin-releasing hormone?
Which of the following causes muscle weakness in Conn's syndrome?
Which of the following is not a result of iodine deficiency?
Pheochromocytoma is a tumor of which of the following?
Which of these is a characteristic clinical feature of hypothyroidism?
Which of the following is not a microvascular complication of long-standing diabetes?

A 40-year-old woman comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of increased frequency of micturition and passing very large quantities of pale urine. She says that she is always thirsty. On radiography, a hypothalamic lesion is seen. The lesion is affecting which of the following nuclei?

Thyroiditis is the inflammation of the thyroid gland encompassing a number of disorders that have some elements of inflammation. Subacute thyroiditis is believed to be triggered by which of the following insults?

A 45-year-old patient has been prescribed the 4-drug anti-tuberculous regimen for the next 3 months following a diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis. However, a few days later it is reported that the patient expired. What underlying undiagnosed condition most likely resulted in the demise of this patient?
What is the most common cause of congenital hypothyroidism in iodine sufficient regions?
Which of the following is the cause of central hypothyroidism?
Which of the following conditions causes hyperthyroidism?
Which of the following is the very first test to be done for hypothyroidism?
Hyperparathyroidism leads to a decrease in plasma levels of which of these?

A 34-year-old female comes to the outpatient department with uncontrolled hypertension. A computed tomography (CT) scan reveals bilateral enlargement of the suprarenal gland. What is the most probable cause?

A 35-year-old lady is diagnosed with autoimmune hypothyroidism. Her physician is concerned about thyroid autoantibodies. Which of the following is the most appropriate antibody to detect autoimmune thyroid disease?
Which is the most common site of thyroglossal cyst?

answers.option: Near the lower border of mandible
Near lower border of the body of the hyoid bone

question: What does pheochromocytoma, a rare tumor, secrete?
Which of the following is a characteristic of hyperthyroidism?
Mutation in which of the following genes is the most common cause of pituitary adenoma caused by genetic defects?
Which one of the following is a characteristic sign of hyperthyroidism?
Which of the following is true regarding the lab diagnosis of hyperthyroidism?

answers.option: Free T3 and T4 levels decreased

question: A 40-year-old lady comes to the outpatient department with a painful swelling on the neck. She has high T3 and T4 and her TSH is diminished. The thyroid gland is tender and palpable. What is the most likely cause of her thyrotoxicosis?
One major clinical manifestation of hypoparathyroidism is tetany which is a hallmark of which of these?
A patient presented to the clinic with the symptoms of hyperthyroidism. Which of the following should be assessed to confirm the diagnosis?
Hurthle cells show:
Hashimoto thyroiditis can lead to:

A 30-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with pain in the lower abdomen and has passed three stones in the urine. She also has high calcium and low phosphate levels in her blood. What is the diagnosis?
A 40-year-old man comes to the outpatient department with an enlarged face, prognathism and swollen hands and feet. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Cretinism is due to:

answers.option: Hypothyroidism during fetal life, infancy & childhood

question: Diabetes insipidus is caused by deficiency of which hormone?
Type I diabetes is associated with which of the following?
Chvostek sign is seen in which of the following?

A nurse was brought to the emergency with hypoglycemia. Investigations were carried out, which showed high insulin levels with decreased C-peptide. Which of the following is mostly likely responsible for hypoglycemia?
What is the HbA1c cut-off for diabetes mellitus diagnosis?
A female presents to the outpatient department with a central neck mass above the hyoid bone, that moves on tongue protrusion. Which of the following will be the probable diagnosis?
What is referred to as a combination of Hashimoto thyroiditis and Addison's disease?
Which of the following is a metabolic complication arising from insulin-dependent diabetes?

answers.option: Both relative and absolute deficiency of insulin

question: Which of the following conditions causes amenorrhea, obesity, and constipation?
Which of these is the least frequent thyroid tumor?
There is increased uptake of radioactive iodine in a solitary area of the thyroid gland. What is most likely present in that area?

A 10-year-old-girl is brought to the emergency room in a semi-conscious state with a complaint of abdominal pain for the past 10 hours. On examination, she is visibly drowsy and has a peculiar fruity smell in her breath. What is the most likely cause to be considered in this case?
Why is insulin administered in diabetic ketoacidosis?

answers.option: To decrease glucose uptake by liver
To decrease glucose uptake by fat cells
To stimulate ketone utilization in brain tissue
To increase glucose uptake by muscle

question: What is the most common cause of Addison's disease in the West?
Which of the following is not a symptom of hyperthyroidism?

A woman presented to the clinic with the complaint of weight loss despite having a good appetite, increased sweating, and oligomenorrhea. Her laboratory results show increased thyroid hormone levels in the body. Which of the following is the most likely cause for the woman's symptoms?
Which of the following is increased in hypothyroidism?
Pheochromocytoma is a tumor of which cell type?
Which of the following is confirmatory for pheochromocytoma?

answers.option: Increased vanillylmandelic acid (VMA) and homovanillic acid (HVA) levels

question: Which of the following test should be performed for pheochromocytoma?
Decreased tissue response to the parathyroid hormone is seen in which of the following condition?
What happens to osmolality and serum sodium levels, respectively, in diabetes insipidus?
An excess of growth hormone in childhood leads to what pathology?
What is nephrocalcinosis?
In which of the following conditions thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) is not responsive to thyroid-releasing hormone (TRH)?
Pheochromocytoma is a neoplasm that secretes which of the following?
Deficiency of which of the following hormone causes the life-threatening conditions?
The most common site for neural crest tumor in children is:
Which of the following is seen in Addison's disease?

answers.option: Decrease in both aldosterone and cortisol

question: Which of the following is affected by the pituitary tumors to cause an increase in cortisol?
Which of the following is not associated with hyperparathyroidism?
Trousseau's sign is characterized by:
Chovestek sign is characterized by:
Which of the following causes lead to muscle weakness in Conn syndrome?
A patient presents with swelling in his right leg and edema. He is diagnosed with Hashimoto thyroiditis. Which of the following is true for the reason behind fluid accumulation in his leg?
In diabetes mellitus gangrene of the lower extremity is caused by which of the following?
A middle-aged man presents to the outpatient department with mild hypothermia. A physical examination reveals goiter, sparse hair, ptosis, and non-pitting edema. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A diabetes mellitus patient wants to drink insulin instead of using the injection to avoid pain. Which of the following would be true as an after effect?
Which of the following is the ocular change in hypoparathyroidism?
Which of the following leads to hypercalcemia?
Which of the following is the most common etiology of hypothyroidism?
Which of the following is the most common cause of Cushing's syndrome?
Gigantism is due to hypersecretion of which of the following cells?

An 18-year-old female presents with weight gain, thinning of hair, low pulse and blood pressure, cold intolerance, clammy skin that is cold, constipation, and difficulty to concentrate. What would be the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following diseases affects both mineralocorticoid and glucocorticoid secretion?
Parathyroid adenoma is most commonly associated with which of the following?

A newborn was diagnosed with multiple congenital anomalies and was having seizures right after it was born with a glucose level of 19 mg/dl. What would be the disease the mother is suffering from to cause these defects in the child?
A lady was taking oral glucocorticoids as per her doctor's recommendation. After that, she went for surgery due to a hip fracture. Which of the following would be a cause of bone fracture?
Which of the following is the most appropriate investigation for long-term monitoring of glucose levels?
A man presents with enlarged hands and is diagnosed with acromegaly. Which of the following was used to confirm the diagnosis?
Which of the following is an indication for vasopressin?
Which of the following is one of the major problems in diabetes mellitus?
What is the most common cause of congenital hypothyroidism?

answers.option: Failure of thyroid gland to develop
Lack of iodine intake in childhood

question: Best diagnostic test for Cushing syndrome:

answers.option: 24-hour urine collection for analysis of free cortisol

question: A woman comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of restlessness for 3 months. She also has painless swellings in her neck. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is wrong regarding Sheehan syndrome?

answers.option: It is associated with antepartum hemorrhage
It is a result of ischemic necrosis of pituitary
During pregnancy anterior pituitary enlarges to twice its size
It is associated with infarction of the anterior lobe
It is associated with postpartum hemorrhage

question: Hypopituitarism can result from hemorrhage into a pituitary adenoma. What is this condition known as?

A 30-year-old woman suffering from diabetes presents to the outpatient department with lightheadedness and bone pain. Her serum calcitonin and calcium levels are low and phosphate levels are high. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 56-year-old man presents to the outpatient department with pain in his phalanges. He is found to have high levels of parathyroid hormone and hypercalcemia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following symptoms is associated with hypothyroidism?
Which of the following is responsible for hyperpigmentation in Addisons disease?
Which of the following cells is destroyed in type 1 diabetes mellitus?
Hürthle cells are present in which of the following?
Which of the following is an autoimmune disorder resulting in hyperthyroidism?
Which of the following will result from a lesion at the optic chiasma?
Testosterone is produced under the control of which of the following hormones?
A patient was diagnosed with Addison's disease. Which of the following would explain the symptom of orthostatic hypotension in this patient?
Which of the following is the active circulating thyroid hormone?
Prolactinoma is a tumor of which of the following?
Which of the following is not a microvascular complication of diabetes?
What is released from the bone marrow in excess amounts in erythroblastosis fetalis?

A 50-year-old male patient came into the outpatient department with yellowish pigmentation of the skin, itching, and was diagnosed as a case of obstructive jaundice. What is the most likely cause of this patient's jaundice?

answers.option: Cancer in the head of pancreas
Cancer in the body of pancreas

question: In the absence of ADH, the permeability of the distal tubules and collecting ducts to water is low, causing the kidneys to excrete large amounts of dilute urine. This condition is known as which of the following?
Polyuria can occur in which of the following?

A 55-year-old man complains of muscle weakness and dizziness for 4 months. His blood pressure is 190/105 mmHg. Laboratory results show hypernatremia, hypokalemia, elevated serum aldosterone, and low renin and angiotensin. Blood urea nitrogen (BUN) is 26 mg/dL, and creatinine is 1.3 mg/dL. The attending physician rules out Cushing syndrome. Which of the following is the most likley cause of hypertension in this patient?

A 16-year-old is brought to the emergency department with diabetic ketoacidosis. Upon checking blood glucose levels, he is diagnosed with type 1 diabetes. Insulin is administered and advised for the future as well. What is the cause of his condition?

A 61-year-old diabetic comes into the emergency room. His laboratory results shows a random blood sugar of 890 mg/dL and serum osmolarity of 460 mOsm. The patient is dehydrated and confused. What is this condition known as?

A 55-year-old housewife presents to the clinic with complaints of feeling tired and partaking in heavy daytime sleepiness. She also complains of breathlessness and feeling cold all the time. Her face is puffy with dry, coarse skin. She has a dull expression on her face and her tongue protrudes from her mouth. Further examination shows midline neck swelling and edema of her legs. Which laboratory investigation will be the most useful in diagnosing her condition?

answers.option: Ultrasound scan of her neck swelling

question: Hypothyroidism is caused by structural or functional derangement that interferes with thyroid hormone production. Which of the following statements regarding hypothyroidism is correct?

answers.option: Hashimoto thyroiditis is an important cause in the developed world
Throughout the world, hypothyroidism is associated with zinc deficiency
Most common cause in iodine deficient areas of Pakistan is Grave's diesease
Thyroid opthalmopathy with proptosis is a common feature
In infants, it results in myxoedema

question: Physical examination of a neonate shows a markedly virilized and hypertrophic clitoris with partial fusion of the labioscrotal folds in a female having 46, XX karyotype. Laboratory studies will most likely reveal a deficiency of which of the following?

Autopsy of an 8-week-old infant reveals massive bilateral adrenal enlargement, who died after developing severe dehydration and hypotension. Hypovolemic shock in this infant was most likely caused by inadequate synthesis of which of the following hormones?
A 35-year-old female comes to the clinic with symptoms of hypothyroidism. The physician is concerned about thyroid auto-antibodies. Which antibody is most commonly observed in Hashimoto thyroiditis?
A child presents with very tall height and large viscera and is diagnosed with gigantism. Increased activity of which cells of the anterior pituitary are responsible for this condition?
Which of the following are seen with lactotroph adenoma?
Which of the following is the most common cause of hyperthyroidism or thyrotoxicosis?
A person is diagnosed with hypothyroidism and goiter. Her laboratory tests most likely show which of the following?

answers.option: Decreased TSH and decreased T3, T4
Increased TSH and increased T3, T4
Decreased TSH and increased T3, T4
Increased TSH and decreased T3, T4

question: A young woman comes into the emergency room experiencing vertigo, nausea, bradycardia, failure to lactate, and loss of genital and axillary hair. She has given birth one month before and stayed in the hospital for 1 week postpartum. What is the most probable diagnosis?
In thyrotoxicosis, laboratory tests will most likely show which of the following?

answers.option: Increased T3, T4, and decreased TSH
Increased T3, T4, TSH (thyroid-stimulating hormone), and TRH (thyroid-releasing hormone)
Increased T3, T4, and decreased TSH, TRH

question: A person comes to the clinic with polydipsia and polyuria with blood glucose levels of 84 mg/dL. Deficiency of which hormone is responsible for this condition?
A person has diabetes mellitus type-2. The dysfunction of which of the following cells is responsible for this condition?

A 30-year-old woman comes into the clinic with a history of irritability, loose stools, and weight loss. The doctor suspects an autoimmune condition and suggests antibody tests. Antibodies against which of the following will be found?
Which of the following is the most common cause of endogenous Cushing syndrome?
The autoimmune destruction of beta cells results in which of the following diseases?
The differentiation between ACTH (adrenocorticotropic hormone)-dependent and ACTH-independent Cushing syndrome is made by administering high doses of which of the following synthetic glucocorticoids?

A 65-year-old woman comes into the outpatient department suffering from polyuria and polydipsia. She looks dehydrated and her skin has lost some turgor. Lab tests show glucosuria +4. What is the most important pathogenesis of this disease?
What is the most important factor in the development of type-1 diabetes?

A 49-year-old female experienced multiple attacks of abdominal pain last year. Three times she had passed stones in the urine during these episodes of pain. Now she is experiencing pain in her right middle finger for one month. On physical examination, her finger is tender. Laboratory reports show calcium 13.7 mg/ dL, phosphate 1.9 mg/ dL, and Creatinine 1.1mg/ dL, albumin 4.8 mg/ dL. Which of the following bone lesions is she most likely to have?

A 54-year-old, married woman para-2 comes to the clinic with the complaint of weight gain and lethargy for the past 3 months. She had her last menstrual period 6 years back. Her blood pressure is 150/90 mmHg, her pulse is 65/min, and is regular bilaterally. Her body mass index (BMI) falls in the obese range. Her eyes are puffy, she complains of breathlessness, and cold intolerance, her skin is coarse and her abdomen has white striations present. What is the best diagnostic test for this woman?

answers.option: Oral glucose tolerance test and TSH

question: A 57-year-old man is found comatose. On physical examination, he has decreased skin turgor. Laboratory studies show a blood glucose of 780 mg/ dL. Urinalysis reveals ketosis and proteinuria along with 4+ glycosuria. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Ingestion of large quantity of sugar

question: After undergoing total thyroidectomy for follicular carcinoma of the thyroid a 50-year-old man develops a tingling sensation and neuromuscular instability post-operatively. Which of the following laboratory test should be carried out on an urgent basis to determine the further proceedings of the therapy?

A clinical study is performed involving subjects who developed Addison's disease. They were recorded to have laboratory studies with hyponatremia, hyperkalemia, hypoglycemia, and decreased plasma cortisol. They became hypotensive. In some subjects, this disease had an acute onset in less than 2 days. Which of the following conditions is most likely to produce this acute course?

A 30-year-old woman presents to the clinic with palpitations, weight loss, and excessive sweating for almost 5-6 months. She cannot concentrate on carrying out her daily activities especially looking after her children. Recently, she also developed pain in both eyes and her friend told her that one of her eyes has become more prominent than the other. What is the most likely cause of her condition?

A 30-year-old female patient, obese, nondiabetic, presented with significant weight gain, easy fatiguability, and lethargy. On examination, she looked pale, obese, and slightly confused. Her blood pressure is 170/90 mmHg, and her pulse rate is 52 beats/min. She was unable to stand from a sitting position without support and her deep tendon reflexes were diminished. With the given scenario, what is the probable diagnosis?
What is the name of the sweet odor breath that is often associated with uncontrolled diabetes?
A 50-year-old lady presents to the emergency department with an enlarged thyroid, protruded eyes, severe palpitations, sweating, and complaints of fatigue. What is the diagnosis?
What is the marked macrovascular complication of type 2 diabetes mellitus?
A 50-year-old diabetic man presents to the outpatient department. The medication prescribed to him will lower his HbA1c down to which value?
Which of the following may present in a female with hypothyroidism?

A 40-year-old man comes into the outpatient department because of weight loss, increased appetite, and diplopia. On physical examination, his temperature is 37.7° C, pulse is 106/min, respiration rate is 15/min, and blood pressure is 140/80 mmHg. A fine tremor is observed in his outstretched hand. He has bilateral proptosis. The serum laboratory findings include a serum TSH level of 0.1 pU/mL. A radioiodine scan indicates increased diffuse uptake throughout the thyroid, Which of the following best describes the microscopic appearance of the patient's thyroid gland?

answers.option: Destruction of follicles, lymphoid aggregates, and Hurthle cell metaplasia
Enlarged thyroid follicles lined by flattened epithelial cells
Papillary projections in thyroid follicles and lymphoid aggregates in the stroma
Follicular destruction with inflammatory infiltrates containing giant cells
Nodules with nests of cells separated by hyaline stroma that stains with Congo red

question: A 30-year-old man visits the hospital because he has had a headache, weakness, and a 5-kg weight gain over the last 4 months. On physical examination, his face is puffy. His temperature is 36.9°C, pulse is 79/min, and blood pressure is 160/75 mm Hg while lying down. He has cutaneous striae over the lower abdomen and ecchymoses scattered over the extremities. A radiograph of the spine shows a compressed fracture of T11. Laboratory findings show a fasting plasma glucose level of 200 mg/dL, the plasma cortisol level is 38 pg/dL at 8:00 am and 37 pg/dL at 6:00 pm. Which of the following conditions is most likely to be present in this patient?

answers.option: Small-cell carcinoma of the lung with bilateral hyperplasia of the adrenal cortex
Corticotroph adenoma of the anterior pituitary with bilateral hyperplasia of the adrenal cortex
Corticotroph adenoma of the anterior pituitary, medullary carcinoma of thyroid, and bilateral nodular hyperplasia of the adrenal cortex
Adenoma of the right adrenal cortex with atrophy of the contralateral adrenal cortex
Adenoma of the right adrenal cortex without atrophy of contralateral adrenal cortex

question: A 40-year-old man visits the physician due to weakness and easy fatiguability for 2 months. On physical examination, there are no remarkable findings. Laboratory studies show serum calcium of 11.5 mg/dl, inorganic phosphorus of 2.4 mg/dl, and parathyroid hormone of 54 pg/ml, which is near the top of the reference range. Radionuclear bone scan fails to show any uptake. What is the most likely cause of these findings?

A 35-year-old woman presents with complaints of feeling of fullness in her neck but has no other complaints. The enlargement has been gradual and painless for more than 1 year. Physical examination confirms diffuse enlargement of the thyroid gland without any apparent masses. Laboratory studies of thyroid function show a normal free T4 level and a slightly increased TSH level. What is the most likely cause of these findings?

A 23-year-old, previously healthy woman died suddenly after complaining of a mild sore throat the previous day. At autopsy, her adrenal glands are enlarged, and there are extensive bilateral cortical hemorrhages. Which of the following organisms best accounts for these findings?

A 32-year-old woman with systemic lupus erythematosus has been treated with corticosteroid therapy for several years, because of recurrent lupus nephritis. While on vacation, she undergoes an emergency appendectomy for acute appendicitis. On postoperative day 2, she becomes somnolent and develops severe nausea and vomiting. She then becomes hypotensive. Blood cultures are negative, and laboratory studies now show Na+ of 128 mmol/L, K+ of 4.9 mmol/L, Cl- of 89 mmol/L, CO2 of 19 mmol/L, glucose of 52 mg/dL, and creatinine of 1.3 mg/dL. Which of the following morphologic findings in the adrenal glands is most likely to be present in this patient?

answers.option: Solitary 1-cm adenoma without atrophy of the contralateral adrenal cortex

question: A 42-year-old man sees his physician because he has had polyuria and polydipsia for the last 4 months. His medical history shows that he fell off a ladder and hit his head just before the onset of these problems. On physical examination, there are no specific findings. Laboratory findings include serum Na+, 155 mmol/L; K+, 3.9 mmol/L; Cl-, 111 mmol/L; C02,27 mmol/L; glucose 84 mg/dL; creatinine, 1 mg/dL; and osmolality, 350 mOsm/mL. The specific gravity of urine is 1.002. This patient is most likely to have a deficiency of which of the following hormones?

A 25-year-old woman has noted breast secretions for the last 1 month. She is not breastfeeding and has never been pregnant. She has not menstruated for the past 5 months. Physical examination yields no abnormal findings. MRI of the brain shows a 0.7-cm mass in the adenohypophysis. Which of the following additional complications is most likely to be present in this patient?

answers.option: Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion

question: A 23-year-old woman has a routine health status examination. Her body mass index is 22. Laboratory studies show fasting plasma glucose is 120 mg/dL. Urinalysis shows mild glucosuria, but no ketonuria or proteinuria. She has no detectable insulin autoantibodies. Her father was similarly affected at age 20. She is most likely to have a mutation in a gene encoding for which of the following?

A 51-year-old man has noted increasing weakness and weight gain over the past 5 months. He has experienced low back pain for the past week. On physical examination, vital signs include a temperature of 37.3°C, pulse of 80/min, respirations of 15/min, and blood pressure of 155/95 mm Hg. He has bilateral breast enlargement, testicular atrophy, and a prominent fat pad in the posterior neck and back. His serum ACTH level is low. A radiograph of the spine shows decreased bone density with a compression fracture at T9, Which of the following findings is most likely to be present in this patient?

answers.option: Pulmonary 6-cm right hilar mass on chest radiograph
Sella turcica enlargement with erosion on head CT scan
Decreased radionuclide uptake in a thyroid gland nodule
Left adrenal 10-cm solid mass with abdominal CT scan
Retroperitoneal 5-cm mass at the aortic bifurcation on pelvic MRI scan

question: A research study wants to check thyroid activity in a selected population. Which test will be the most sensitive for that?
A child born to a mother who is suffering from iodine deficiency is likely to be born with which of the following condition?
A diabetic patient’s scan showed renal nodules that are PAS-positive, along with tubular atrophy and interstitial fibrosis. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 60-year-old man with an adrenal cortex tumor came to the ER with high blood pressure, an abnormal ECG, and hypokalemia. An excess of which hormone would cause this condition?

A woman has muscle weakness, softening of bones, and increased frequency of fractures. She has low calcium, phosphate, and alkaline phosphatase levels. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis?
